data.title: George Dickinson Service Details - Sidney, Nebraska
data.meta_description: GEORGE E. DICKINSON  	George E. Dickinson, age 71, longtime Lodgepole, NE resident passed away in Sidney, Thursday, October 4, 2018. 	Memorial services will be held at 10:30 A.M., Saturday, October 13th in the Gloria Dei Lutheran Church in Lodgepole with Brenda Tophoj P.M.A. officiating.  Inurnment will follow in the Pleasant View Cemetery north of Lodgepole.  Cremation has been held.  Friends may stop at the Gehrig-Stitt Chapel on Friday to sign George’s register book and drop off condolences for the family.  Memorial contributions may be made in George’s name to Women of the Gloria Dei Lutheran Church.  You may view George’s Book of Memories, leave condolences, photos and stories at www.gehrigstittchapel.com.  Gehrig-Stitt Chapel & Cremation Service, LLC is in charge of George’s care and funeral arrangements.          George Edward Dickinson was born on May 30, 1947 to Billy William Dickinson and Clarabelle Lavina (Sanders) Dickinson at the Taylor Hospital in Sidney, NE. George grew up on the Dickinson family farm SE of Sunol. He attended school in Sunol and graduated from 8th grade. George grew up as one of seven boys.                                                                                                                                            Growing up with a family who used horses to till and plant the fields and horses to mow the meadow and put up hay, George worked alongside his Dad, Uncle George and brothers to make a living and have food for the family and animals.  Cows were milked, the milk was separated and cream was sold to neighbors. During the summer, some cream was always saved to make ice cream for the family to enjoy. George worked for over 50 years at the Sidney, Chappell and Ogallala Auction Barns, and made extra money helping local farmers and ranchers with odd jobs. George was always ready to tease. He always helped friends and neighbors when asked.           Proceeding him in death were his parents Billy and Clarabelle; Grandparents, Irvin W.  and Klara Alvina (Rahe) Sanders, George Washington and Fanny (Kilgore) Dickinson, brother Leroy Dickinson and wife Pat (Saali) Dickinson, brother Jim Dickinson, and nephews Joe and Eric Dickinson.         He is survived by 4 brothers: Dale (Bonita) Dickinson, Kenneth (Susan) Dickinson,  Gene (Judy) Dickinson and Dan (Kristi) Dickinson, special friends; Ron and Jeanie Houck and Linda Bruns as well as numerous nieces, nephews, and cousins.
data.text:
Condolences & Tributes

We encourage you to share any memorable photos or stories about George. All tributes placed on and purchased through this memorial website will remain on in perpetuity for future generations.

JK

Sorry for you loss. George was a nice person and friendly

joanna Kepler - Saturday October 06, 2018 via Condolence Message
